Quick Help

Home

Here are the review buttons you'll see during study sessions and what they do.

Front Side

When you see the question and need to decide how to proceed:

  • ğŸ‘€

    Show me

    Reveal the translation or answer â€” use when you need a hint.

  • ğŸ’ª

    Confident

    You know this well â€” move to the next card immediately.

Back Side

After seeing the answer, rate how well you remembered:

  • â˜ï¸

    Again

    You want to try this card again in the current review session.

  • ğŸ™‚

    Good

    You remembered it but not perfectly â€” normal spacing applies.

  • âœ¨

    Easy

    You remembered it easily â€” the scheduler will space it longer.

Quick tips:

  • Choose Again or Good if you're not yet fluent, so the system will show you this card more frequently.
  • Think of this as memory practice, not a test of knowledge. This mindset makes reviewing more enjoyable.
